alert.note: Alert for Prince George; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 5:19PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Prince George, northwestern Sussex and eastern Dinwiddie Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 518 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sutherland, or near Dinwiddie, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Petersburg, Dinwiddie, Stony Creek, Sutherland, Carson, Burgess, Addison, Reams, Huske, Center Star, Petersburg Airport, Church Road, Five Forks, Templeton and Butterworth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
